name: Glimmerpoint Stag
text:
Vigilance
When Glimmerpoint Stag enters the battlefield, exile another target permanent. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Glimmerpost
text:
When Glimmerpost enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life for each Locus on the battlefield.
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: What once spied upon Mirrodin from above now waits below for another to assume control.

name: Glimmervoid
text:
At the beginning of the end step, if you control no artifacts, sacrifice Glimmervoid.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: An empty canvas holds infinite possibilities.
An empty canvas holds infinite possibilities.

name: Glimmervoid Basin
text:
Whenever a player casts an instant or sorcery spell with a single target, he or she copies that spell for each other spell, permanent, card not on the battlefield, and/or player the spell could target. Each copy targets a different one of them.
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, choose target creature. Each player except that creature's controller creates a token that's a copy of that creature.

name: Glimpse of Nature
text: Whenever you cast a creature spell this turn, draw a card.

editions.flavor: Dosan sat in repose for many hours. He made no motion, no sound at all. And as he sat, nature revealed itself to him.

name: Glimpse the Future
text: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"No simple coin toss can solve this riddle. You must think and choose wisely."
—Shai Fusan, archmage

name: Glimpse the Sun God
text: Tap X target creatures. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

editions.flavor: Better to be beneath Heliod's notice than beneath his heel.

name: Glimpse the Unthinkable
text: Target player puts the top ten cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"I am confident that if anyone actually penetrates our facades, even the most perceptive would still be fundamentally unprepared for the truth of House Dimir."
—Szadek

name: Glint
text: Target creature you control gets +0/+3 and gains hexproof until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

editions.flavor: Rakshasa waste no opportunity to display their wealth and power, even in the midst of a sorcerous duel.

name: Glint-Eye Nephilim
text:
Whenever Glint-Eye Nephilim deals combat damage to a player, draw that many cards.
{1}, Discard a card: Glint-Eye Nephilim gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: When it awoke, it shook the plane with the thunder of its craving.
When it awoke, it shook the plane with the thunder of its craving.

name: Glint Hawk
text:
Flying
When Glint Hawk enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an artifact you control to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Its eyes burned nearly blind by the Whitesun, it hunts by metallic gleam.

name: Glint Hawk Idol
text:
Whenever another artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may have Glint Hawk Idol become a 2/2 Bird artifact creature with flying until end of turn.
{W}: Glint Hawk Idol becomes a 2/2 Bird artifact creature with flying until end of turn.

name: Glint-Nest Crane
text:
Flying
When Glint-Nest Crane enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal an artifact card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

name: Glint-Sleeve Artisan
text: Fabricate 1 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it or create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.)

editions.flavor: "Shine bright, bolts tight."

name: Glint-Sleeve Siphoner
text:
Menace
Whenever Glint-Sleeve Siphoner enters the battlefield or attacks, you get {E} (an energy counter).
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {E}{E}. If you do, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.

name: Glintwing Invoker
text: {7}{U}: Glintwing Invoker gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The Mirari flares in his mind.

name: Glissa's Courier
text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

editions.flavor:
"So, the survivors from Oxid Ridge are on the move. Let them come and witness predation in its purest form."
—Glissa

name: Glissa's Scorn
text: Destroy target artifact. Its controller loses 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"If it were fit to survive, it wouldn't have been so easily put down."
—Glissa

name: Glissa Sunseeker
text:
First strike
{T}: Destroy target artifact if its converted mana cost is equal to the amount of mana in your mana pool.

editions.flavor: "There's a secret at the heart of this world, and I will unlock it."

name: Glissa, the Traitor
text:
First strike, deathtouch
Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, you may return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: Once Mirrodin's brightest hope. Now Phyrexia's dark champion.

name: Glistener Elf
text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

editions.flavor: "Beg me for life, and I will fill you with the glory of Phyrexian perfection."
"Beg me for life, and I will fill you with the glory of Phyrexian perfection."

name: Glistening Oil
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has infect.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a -1/-1 counter on enchanted creature.
When Glistening Oil is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Glistening Oil to its owner's hand.

name: Glitterfang
text:
Haste
At the beginning of the end step, return Glitterfang to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"Through the veil's rip spilled hundreds of minor kami, rushing over the battlefield like embers from a kicked campfire. Then they were gone."
—Great Battles of Kamigawa

name: Glittering Lion
text:
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Glittering Lion.
{3}: Until end of turn, Glittering Lion loses "Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Glittering Lion." Any player may activate this ability.

name: Glittering Lynx
text:
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Glittering Lynx.
{2}: Until end of turn, Glittering Lynx loses "Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Glittering Lynx." Any player may activate this ability.

name: Glittering Wish
text: You may choose a multicolored card you own from outside the game, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Exile Glittering Wish.

editions.flavor: She wished for gold, but not for the strength to carry it.

name: Global Ruin
text: Each player chooses from the lands he or she controls a land of each basic land type, then sacrifices the rest.

editions.flavor:
"The earth shook, the sky rained fire, and it seemed the world was ending."
—Benalish refugee

name: Gloom
text:
White spells cost {3} more to cast.
Activated abilities of white enchantments cost {3} more to activate.

name: Gloomdrifter
text:
Flying
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Gloomdrifter has "When Gloomdrifter enters the battlefield, nonblack creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn."

name: Gloomhunter
text: Flying

editions.flavor: Scavengers both mundane and magical follow in its wake, feeding on the scraps of flesh and spirit it leaves behind.

name: Gloomlance
text: Destroy target creature. If that creature was green or white, its controller discards a card.

editions.flavor: Death stings the victim only once, but those left behind feel the pain of loss with every passing memory.

name: Gloom Surgeon
text: If combat damage would be dealt to Gloom Surgeon, prevent that damage and exile that many cards from the top of your library.

editions.flavor: He roams the streets of Havengul seeking the sick and delirious so that he may cure them of their lives.

name: Gloomwidow
text:
Reach
Gloomwidow can block only creatures with flying.

editions.flavor:
"An unexpected ally."
—Rem Karolus, Slayer of Angels
When gloomwidows mature, they abandon venom in favor of massive webs that span the eaves of cliffs.
The abandoned towns on the moors didn't stay empty for long.

name: Gloomwidow's Feast
text: Destroy target creature with flying. If that creature was blue or black, create a 1/2 green Spider creature token with reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)

editions.flavor: Each night, gloomwidows cull fresh prey for their ravenous hatchlings.

name: Glorious Anthem
text: Creatures you control get +1/+1.

editions.flavor: Once heard, the battle song of an angel becomes part of the listener forever.
Each victory adds a new verse.

"North and South meet and angels sing.
Voices resound with a righteous ring."
—"The Ballad of the Paladins"
Each victory adds a new verse.
Once heard, the battle song of an angel becomes part of the listener forever.
Once heard, the battle song of an angel becomes part of the listener forever.
Once heard, the battle song of an angel becomes part of the listener forever.
The songs of angels are perceived not as words in the ears but as stirrings in the soul.

name: Glorious Charge
text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"One's blade is only as sharp as one's conviction."
—Ajani Goldmane

"One's blade is only as sharp as one's conviction."
—Ajani Goldmane

name: Glorious End
text:
End the turn. (Exile all spells and abilities on the stack, including this card. The player whose turn it is discards down to his or her maximum hand size. Damage wears off, and "this turn" and "until end of turn" effects end.)
At the beginning of your next end step, you lose the game.

name: Glory
text:
Flying
{2}{W}: Choose a color. Creatures you control gain protection from the chosen color until end of turn. Activate this ability only if Glory is in your graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"Glory was gone; Glory was everywhere."
—Scroll of Beginnings

"Glory was gone; Glory was everywhere."
—Scroll of Beginnings

name: Glory-Bound Initiate
text: You may exert Glory-Bound Initiate as it attacks. When you do, it gets +1/+3 and gains lifelink until end of turn. (An exerted creature won't untap during your next untap step.)

editions.flavor:
"Fly as an arrow through the trials, and never waver in your course."
—Oketra, god of solidarity

name: Glorybringer
text:
Flying, haste
You may exert Glorybringer as it attacks. When you do, it deals 4 damage to target non-Dragon creature an opponent controls. (An exerted creature won't untap during your next untap step.)

editions.flavor: What the initiates face in the final trial is completely at Hazoret's discretion.

name: Glory of Warfare
text:
As long as it's your turn, creatures you control get +2/+0.
As long as it's not your turn, creatures you control get +0/+2.

editions.flavor: "Their hopes dashed on our shields! Their victory slashed by our swords!"
"Their hopes dashed on our shields! Their victory slashed by our swords!"

name: Gloryscale Viashino
text: Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, Gloryscale Viashino gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"This is a new world and a new war. We need warriors who know chaos and how to combat it."
—Lisha of the Azure
The turning of the tide always begins with one soldier's decision to head back into the fray.
"There's no contract to sign, no oath to swear. The enlistment procedure is to unsheathe your sword and point it at the enemy."
The turning of the tide always begins with one soldier's decision to head back into the fray.
"There's no contract to sign, no oath to swear. The enlistment procedure is to unsheathe your sword and point it at the enemy."
The turning of the tide always begins with one soldier's decision to head back into the fray.

name: Glowering Rogon
text: Amplify 1 (As this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it for each Beast card you reveal in your hand.)

editions.flavor: A herd of one.

name: Glowing Anemone
text: When Glowing Anemone enters the battlefield, you may return target land to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Beautiful to behold, terrible to be held.

name: Glowrider
text: Noncreature spells cost {1} more to cast.

editions.flavor: "It is not yet time."

name: Gluetius Maximus
text:
As Gluetius Maximus comes into play, an opponent chooses one of your fingers. (Thumbs are fingers, too.)
When the chosen finger isn't touching Gluetius Maximus, sacrifice Gluetius Maximus.

name: Gluttonous Cyclops
text: {5}{R}{R}: Monstrosity 3. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put three +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)

editions.flavor: The cyclops had learned to never eat a shepherd. Instead he gently flung the "pit" aside to grow a new flock.

name: Gluttonous Slime
text:
Flash
Devour 1 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with that many +1/+1 counters on it.)

editions.flavor: On Jund, everything eventually ends up in something else's stomach.
On Jund, everything eventually ends up in something else's stomach.
On Jund, everything eventually ends up in something else's stomach.

name: Gluttonous Zombie
text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

editions.flavor: Greed and gluttony led him to death. Now they are his greatest assets.
Greed and gluttony led him to death. Now they are his greatest assets.
Greed and gluttony led him to death. Now they are his greatest assets.

name: Glyph Keeper
text:
Flying
Whenever Glyph Keeper becomes the target of a spell or ability for the first time each turn, counter that spell or ability.
Embalm {5}{U}{U} ({5}{U}{U}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of it, except it's a white Zombie Sphinx with no mana cost. Embalm only as a sorcery.)

name: Glyph of Delusion
text: Put X glyph counters on target creature that target Wall blocked this turn, where X is the power of that blocked creature. The creature gains "This creature doesn't untap during your untap step if it has a glyph counter on it" and "At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a glyph counter from this creature."

name: Glyph of Destruction
text: Target blocking Wall you control gets +10/+0 until end of combat. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to it this turn. Destroy it at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Glyph of Doom
text: Choose target Wall creature. At this turn's next end of combat, destroy all creatures that were blocked by that creature this turn.

editions.flavor: "He knows he has a short span of life, that the day will come when he must pass through the wall of oblivion . . ." —William Faulkner

name: Glyph of Life
text: Choose target Wall creature. Whenever that creature is dealt damage by an attacking creature this turn, you gain that much life.

editions.flavor: Any wall can be battered down, but at what cost?

name: Glyph of Reincarnation
text:
Cast Glyph of Reincarnation only after combat.
Destroy all creatures that were blocked by target Wall this turn. They can't be regenerated. For each creature that died this way, put a creature card from the graveyard of the player who controlled that creature the last time it became blocked by that Wall onto the battlefield under its owner's control.

name: Gnarled Effigy
text: {4}, {T}: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

editions.flavor:
"Bits of fallen scarecrow, laces of elfskin leather, teeth of an axeshark merrow . . . An industrious soul can find new uses for the most mundane items."
—Mowagh the Gwyllion

"On the fifty-seventh day of the Battle of Silk, the bell again tolled in hopes of summoning mortal aid. This time, a new breed of kami rose to answer its call."
—Great Battles of Kamigawa

name: Gnarled Scarhide
text:
Bestow {3}{B} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Gnarled Scarhide can't block.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1 and can't block.

name: Gnarlid Pack
text:
Multikicker {1}{G} (You may pay an additional {1}{G} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Gnarlid Pack enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each time it was kicked.

name: Gnarlroot Trapper
text:
{T}, Pay 1 life: Add {G} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast an Elf creature spell.
{T}: Target attacking Elf you control gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

name: Gnarlwood Dryad
text:
Deathtouch
Delirium — Gnarlwood Dryad gets +2/+2 as long as there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: As Emrakul's influence radiated across Innistrad, evacuation from Kessig's remote villages became increasingly difficult.

name: Gnat Alley Creeper
text: Gnat Alley Creeper can't be blocked by creatures with flying.

editions.flavor: Despite its diminutive name, Gnat Alley is the longest street in Ravnica. Mile after twisting mile, it threads its way among the broader, safer thoroughfares like a parasite.

name: Gnathosaur
text: Sacrifice an artifact: Gnathosaur gains trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Mirran creatures that could withstand the Phyrexian oil found an abundance of crunchy snacks.

name: Gnat Miser
text: Each opponent's maximum hand size is reduced by one.

editions.flavor: Nezumi insect-shamans enjoyed solitary lives, which was fortunate since no other nezumi could stand to live within half a mile of their foul stench.

name: Gnawing Zombie
text: {1}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: On still nights you can hear its rotted teeth grinding tirelessly on scavenged bones.
On still nights you can hear its rotted teeth grinding tirelessly on scavenged bones.

name: Gnaw to the Bone
text:
You gain 2 life for each creature card in your graveyard.
Flashback {2}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Goatnapper
text: When Goatnapper enters the battlefield, untap target Goat and gain control of it until end of turn. It gains haste until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Kith goats are just for practice. The real prize, of course, is a giant's cloudgoat.

name: Gobbling Ooze
text: {G}, Sacrifice another creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Gobbling Ooze.

editions.flavor: The furious citizens blamed the Simic for releasing it in their district. The Simic pointed out that rats were no longer a problem.

name: Gobhobbler Rats
text: Hellbent — As long as you have no cards in hand, Gobhobbler Rats gets +1/+0 and has "{B}: Regenerate Gobhobbler Rats."

editions.flavor: Lyzolda's pet rats eat better than the average citizen. In fact, they can usually be found eating the average citizen.

name: Goblin Archaeologist
text: {R}, {T}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy target artifact and untap Goblin Archaeologist. If you lose the flip, sacrifice Goblin Archaeologist.

editions.flavor: Always easily impressed, Durg was about to be blown away.

name: Goblin Arsonist
text: When Goblin Arsonist dies, you may have it deal 1 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: With great power comes great risk of getting yourself killed.
With great power comes great risk of getting yourself killed.
With great power comes great risk of getting yourself killed.
With great power comes great risk of getting yourself killed.

name: Goblin Artillery
text: {T}: Goblin Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.

editions.flavor: Most goblins get their turn firing the catapult, but few achieve the coveted title of Ammunition Holder.

name: Goblin Artisans
text: {T}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, draw a card. If you lose the flip, counter target artifact spell you control that isn't the target of an ability from another creature named Goblin Artisans.

name: Goblin Assassin
text: Whenever Goblin Assassin or another Goblin enters the battlefield, each player flips a coin. Each player whose coin comes up tails sacrifices a creature.

editions.flavor: The more victims he kills, the more likely he is to get the right one.

name: Goblin Assault
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, create a 1/1 red Goblin creature token with haste.
Goblin creatures attack each turn if able.

editions.flavor: A goblin raid is a delicate gambit—a blend of stealth, precision, and screaming death.
A goblin raid is a delicate gambit—a blend of stealth, precision, and screaming death.

name: Goblin Balloon Brigade
text: {R}: Goblin Balloon Brigade gains flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"From up here we can drop rocks and arrows and more rocks!"
"Uh, yeah boss, but how do we get down?"
They patched the holes, loaded their sharpest rocks, spanked their children one last time, and lurched off into the sunset.
"The enemy is getting too close! Quick! Inflate the toad!"
"From up here we can drop rocks and arrows and more rocks!" "Uh, yeah boss, but how do we get down?"
"From up here we can drop rocks and arrows and more rocks!" "Uh, yeah boss, but how do we get down?"
"From up here we can drop rocks and arrows and more rocks!" "Uh, yeah boss, but how do we get down?"

"From up here we can drop rocks and arrows and more rocks!"
"Uh, yeah boss, but how do we get down?"
"From up here we can drop rocks and arrows and more rocks!" "Uh, yeah boss, but how do we get down?"

"From up here we can drop rocks and arrows and more rocks!" "Uh, yeah boss, but how do we get down?"
"The enemy is getting too close! Quick! Inflate the toad!"

name: Goblin Bangchuckers
text: {T}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, Goblin Bangchuckers deals 2 damage to target creature or player. If you lose the flip, Goblin Bangchuckers deals 2 damage to itself.

name: Goblin Battle Jester
text: Whenever you cast a red spell, target creature can't block this turn.

editions.flavor: Somehow goblins found a tactical advantage by sending a clown to war.

name: Goblin Berserker
text: First strike, haste

editions.flavor: Goblins don't know the meaning of the word "tactics"—or the word "meaning," for that matter.

name: Goblin Bomb
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may flip a coin. If you win the flip, put a fuse counter on Goblin Bomb. If you lose the flip, remove a fuse counter from Goblin Bomb.
Remove five fuse counters from Goblin Bomb, Sacrifice Goblin Bomb: Goblin Bomb deals 20 damage to target player.

name: Goblin Bombardment
text: Sacrifice a creature: Goblin Bombardment deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: One mogg to aim the catapult, one mogg to steer the rock.
One mogg to aim the catapult, one mogg to steer the rock.
One mogg to aim the catapult, one mogg to steer the rock.
One mogg to aim the catapult, one mogg to steer the rock.
With one motion, a pest is removed and a scourge inflicted.

name: Goblin Bookie
text: {R}, {T}: Reflip any coin or reroll any die.

editions.flavor:
"Glok loved bets! He'd sit in the bar all night an' laugh an' laugh. Hey—he still owes me."
—Squee, goblin casino hand

name: Goblin Boom Keg
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Goblin Boom Keg.
When Goblin Boom Keg is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: Dragonfire spawned many imitations. Some were more dramatic than others.

name: Goblin Bowling Team
text: Whenever Goblin Bowling Team damages any creature or player, roll a six-sided die. Goblin Bowling Team deals to that creature or player additional damage equal to the die roll.

editions.flavor: Flog was out of his league—this game wasn't up his alley, but the team couldn't spare him if he split.

name: Goblin Brawler
text:
First strike
Goblin Brawler can't be equipped.

editions.flavor: Perhaps he shuns technology. Perhaps he appreciates nature. Perhaps he doesn't know the difference.

name: Goblin Brigand
text: Goblin Brigand attacks each turn if able.

editions.flavor: Like a loaded cannon—point and shoot.
After the Skirk Ridge collapsed, the goblins erected a system of ropes and pulleys to hold up what was left.
It's easy to stand head and shoulders over those with no backbone.
It's easy to stand head and shoulders over those with no backbone.

name: Goblin Burrows
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}{R}, {T}: Target Goblin creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins

name: Goblin Bushwhacker
text:
Kicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} as you cast this spell.)
When Goblin Bushwhacker enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, creatures you control get +1/+0 and gain haste until end of turn.

name: Goblin Cadets
text: Whenever Goblin Cadets blocks or becomes blocked, target opponent gains control of it. (This removes Goblin Cadets from combat.)

editions.flavor: "If you kids don't stop that racket, I'm turning this expedition around right now!"
"If you kids don't stop that racket, I'm turning this expedition around right now!"

name: Goblin Cannon
text: {2}: Goblin Cannon deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Sacrifice Goblin Cannon.

editions.flavor: Goblin cannon crews are known not for their aim but for their ability to dive for cover.
They get along so well with their goats because they're practically goats themselves.
They get along so well with their goats because they're practically goats themselves.
They get along so well with their goats because they're practically goats themselves.

name: Goblin Caves
text:
Enchant land
As long as enchanted land is a basic Mountain, Goblin creatures get +0/+2.

editions.flavor: The stench of countless generations of unspeakable activities was enough to loosen both our footing and our stomachs.

name: Goblin Charbelcher
text: {3}, {T}: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a land card. Goblin Charbelcher deals damage equal to the number of nonland cards revealed this way to target creature or player. If the revealed land card was a Mountain, Goblin Charbelcher deals double that damage instead. Put the revealed cards on the bottom of your library in any order.

name: Goblin Chariot
text: Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.)

editions.flavor: The hardest part of his training is learning not to eat the boar.
They have to replace the wheels, they have to replace the boar, and sometimes they have to replace the goblin.
The hardest part of his training is learning not to eat the boar.
The hardest part of his training is learning not to eat the boar.

name: Goblin Chieftain
text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
Other Goblin creatures you control get +1/+1 and have haste.

editions.flavor: "We are goblinkind, heirs to the mountain empires of chieftains past. Rest is death to us, and arson is our call to war."
"We are goblinkind, heirs to the mountain empires of chieftains past. Rest is death to us, and arson is our call to war."
"It's time for the ‘Smash, Smash' song!"

name: Goblin Chirurgeon
text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Regenerate target creature.

editions.flavor:
"Perhaps goblins are good for something after all."
—General Khurzog

"Perhaps Goblins are good for something after all."
—Attributed to General Khurzog
The Chirurgeons patched up their fallen comrades with a gruesome mix of twisted limbs and mangled flesh.

"I asked one of my aides how they do it, but all he'd say was, ‘Trust me, Mayor, you don't want to know.'"
—Lydia Wynforth, Mayor of Trokair

name: Goblin Clearcutter
text: {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Add three mana in any combination of {R} and/or {G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"Did you know that wood burns even better than rocks?"
—Toggo, goblin weaponsmith
